template.name: Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP
template.description:
Zabbix Template for Fortinet FortiGate URL: https://github.com/mbdraks/fortinet-zabbix Author: Michel Barbosa Version: 2.1.0
Exposes information obtained from the following MIBs (import is not required): - SNMPv2-MIB - IF-MIB - EtherLike-MIB - FORTINET-CORE-MIB - FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB
This template also incorporates the exact same data collected by the following default templates (no import or link required): - Generic SNMP - Interfaces SNMP - EtherLike-MIB SNMP

item.name: Logical Description
item.description:
ENTITY-MIB::entLogicalDescr
A textual description of the logical entity. This object should contain a string which identifies the manufacturer's name for the logical entity, and should be set to a distinct value for each version of the logical entity.

item.name: Physical Description
item.description:
ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalDescr
A textual description of physical entity. This object should contain a string which identifies the manufacturer's name for the physical entity, and should be set to a distinct value for each version or model of the physical entity.

item.name: HA Config Sync
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaAutoSync
Configuration of an automatic configuration synchronization (enabled or disabled)

item.name: HA Cluster Group ID
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaSystemMode
HA cluster group ID device is configured for

item.name: HA Cluster Name
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaGroupName
HA cluster group name

item.name: HA Cluster Master Override
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaOverride
Status of a master override flag

item.name: HA Cluster Priority
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaPriority
HA clustering priority of the device (default = 128)

item.name: HA Load-balancing Schedule
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaSchedule
Load-balancing schedule of cluster (in A-A mode)

item.name: HA Mode
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaSystemMode
High-availability mode (Standalone, A-A or A-P)

item.name: Hardware Sensor Count
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHwSensorCount
The number of entries in fgHwSensorTable

item.name: Intrusions detected - Anomaly based
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIpsAnomalyDetections
Number of intrusions detected by signature since start-up in this virtual domain

item.name: Intrusions detected - Critical
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIpsCritSevDetections
Number of critical severity intrusions detected since start-up in this virtual domain

item.name: Intrusions detected - High
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIpsHighSevDetections
Number of high severity intrusions detected since start-up in this virtual domain

item.name: Intrusions detected - Info
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIpsInfoSevDetections
Number of informational severity intrusions detected since start-up in this virtual domain

item.name: Intrusions blocked
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIpsIntrusionsBlocked
Number of intrusions blocked since start-up in this virtual domain

item.name: Intrusions detected
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIpsIntrusionsDetected
Number of intrusions detected since start-up in this virtual domain

item.name: Intrusions detected - Low
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIpsLowSevDetections
Number of low severity intrusions detected since start-up in this virtual domain

item.name: Intrusions detected - Medium
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIpsMedSevDetections
Number of medium severity intrusions detected since start-up in this virtual domain

item.name: Intrusions detected - Signature based
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIpsSignatureDetections
Number of intrusions detected by signature since start-up in this virtual domain

item.name: CPU usage
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgSysCpuUsage
Current CPU usage (percentage)

trigger.name: High CPU usage (over {$CPU.UTIL.CRIT}% for 5m)
trigger.description: CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

item.name: Hard Disk Capacity
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgSysDiskCapacity
Total hard disk capacity (MB), if disk is present

item.name: Hard Disk Usage
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgSysDiskUsage
Current hard disk usage (MB), if disk is present

item.name: Hard Disk Usage Rate
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgSysDiskUsage
Current hard disk usage (MB), if disk is present

item.name: Memory usage
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgSysMemUsage
Current memory utilization (percentage)

trigger.name: High memory usage ( >{$MEMORY.UTIL.MAX}% for 5m)
trigger.description: The system is running out of free memory.

item.name: IPv4 Active sessions
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgSysSesCount
Number of active sessions on the device

item.name: FortiGate Uptime
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgSysUpTime
The 64bit time (in hundredths of a second) since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

item.name: Firmware Version
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgSysVersion
Firmware version of the device

item.name: IPS Database Version
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgSysVersionIps
IPS signature database version installed on the device

item.name: IPS Database Version - Extended
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgSysVersionIpsEt
IPS signature extended database version installed on the device

item.name: VDOM Enabled
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVdEnabled
Whether virtual domains are enabled on this device

item.name: VDOM Max Count
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVdMaxVdoms
The maximum number of virtual domains allowed on the device as allowed by hardware and/or licensing

item.name: VDOM Count
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVdNumber
The number of virtual domains in vdTable

item.name: SSL VPN state
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVpnSslState
Whether SSL-VPN is enabled on this virtual domain

item.name: Active SSL VPN users
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVpnSslStatsLoginUsers
The current number of users logged in through SSL-VPN tunnels in the virtual domain

item.name: Active IPsec VPN tunnels
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVpnTunnelUpCount
The number of IPsec VPN tunnels with at least one SA

item.name: Wireless Controller - Location
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcInfoLocation
Represents the location of an AC

item.name: Wireless Controller - Name
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcInfoName
Represents the name of an AC

item.name: Wireless Controller - Station Capacity
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcInfoStationCapacity
Represents the maximum number of stations that can be supported on the AC.

item.name: Wireless Controller - Station Count
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcInfoStationCount
Represents the number of stations that are accessing the wireless service provided by the AC.

item.name: Wireless Controller - WTP Capacity
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcInfoWtpCapacity
Represents the maximum number of WTPs that can be managed on the AC.

item.name: Wireless Controller - WTP Managed
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcInfoWtpManaged
Represents the number of WTPs being managed on the AC.

item.name: Wireless Controller - WTP Sessions
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcInfoWtpSessions
Represents the number of WTPs that are connecting to the AC.

item.name: Device Serial Number
item.description:
FORTINET-CORE-MIB::fnSysSerial
Device serial number. This is the same serial number as given in the ENTITY-MIB tables for the base entity.
If in HA returns the master SN only.

trigger.name: Unavailable by ICMP ping
trigger.description: Last three attempts returned timeout. Please check device connectivity.

trigger.expression: min(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)<100
trigger.name: High ICMP ping loss

dependency.name: High ICMP ping loss
dependency.expression: min(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)<100

item.name: SNMP traps (fallback)
item.description: Item is used to collect all SNMP traps unmatched by other snmptrap items

item.name: System contact details
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person. If no contact information is known, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: System description
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and networking software.

item.name: System location
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The physical location of this node (e.g., `telephone closet, 3rd floor'). If the location is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: System name
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB An administratively-assigned name for this managed node.By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

trigger.expression: (last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/system.name,#1)<>last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/system.name,#2))=1 and length(last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/system.name))>0
trigger.name: System name has changed (new name: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: System name has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: System object ID
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The vendor's authoritative identification of the network management subsystem contained in the entity. This value is allocated within the SMI enterprises subtree (1.3.6.1.4.1) and provides an easy and unambiguous means for determining`what kind of box' is being managed. For example, if vendor`Flintstones, Inc.' was assigned the subtree1.3.6.1.4.1.4242, it could assign the identifier 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242.1.1 to its `Fred Router'.

item.name: Operating System
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgSysVersion
Firmware version of the device

item.name: Uptime
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The time (in hundredths of a second) since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

trigger.name: No SNMP data collection
trigger.description: SNMP is not available for polling. Please check device connectivity and SNMP settings.

discovery_rule.name: High Availability Discovery
discovery_rule.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsTable
Some useful statistics for all members of a cluster. This table is also available in standalone mode.

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - AV Events Rate
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsAvCount
Number of anti-virus events triggered on the specified cluster member since start-up

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Bytes Processed Rate
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsByteCount
Number of bytes processed by the specified cluster member since start-up

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - CPU Usage
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsCpuUsage
CPU usage of the specified cluster member (percentage)

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Global Checksum
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsGlobalChecksum
Current HA global checksum value

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Hostname
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsHostname
Host name of the specified cluster member

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - IPS Events Rate
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsIdsCount
Number of IDS/IPS events triggered on the specified cluster member since start-up

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Master SN
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsMasterSerial
Serial number of master during the last synch attempt (successful of not)

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Memory Usage
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsMemUsage
Memory usage of the specified cluster member (percentage)

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Network Bandwidth Usage
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsNetUsage
Network bandwidth usage of specified cluster member (kbps)

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Packets Processed Rate
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsPktCount
Number of packets processed by the specified cluster member since start-up

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Serial Number
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsSerial
Serial number of the HA cluster member

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Concurrent Connections
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsSesCount
Current session count of specified cluster member

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Sync Success Time
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsSyncDatimeSucc
Date and time of last successful sync

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Sync Failed Time
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsSyncDatimeUnsucc
Date and time of last unsuccessful sync

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Sync Status
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsSyncStatus
Current HA Sync status

graph_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Network Bandwidth Usage
HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Security Events Rate

discovery_rule.name: Hardware Sensor Discovery
discovery_rule.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHwSensorEntIndex
A list of device specific hardware sensors and values. Because different devices have different hardware sensor capabilities, this table may or may not contain any values.

item_prototype.name: Hardware Sensor {#SENSOR_NAME} - Alarm Status
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHwSensorEntAlarmStatus
If the sensor has an alarm threshold and has exceeded it, this will indicate its status. Not all sensors have alarms.

item_prototype.name: Hardware Sensor {#SENSOR_NAME} - Value
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHwSensorEntValue
A string representation of the value of the sensor. Because sensors can present data in different formats, string representation is most general format. Interpretation of the value (units of measure, for example) is dependent on the individual sensor.

discovery_rule.name: Interface-based Shaping (Egress) Discovery
discovery_rule.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIntfBcEntry
A list of all class-levels with bandwidth usage and packet drop counter. An entry containing the Bandwidth Control statistics, packet drop counter of a given interface.
The data collected by this discovery is the same found using: `diagnose netlink interface list wan1`

item_prototype.name: Allocated Bandwidth - Interface ID {$IF_ID1} - Class ID {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIntfBcAllocatedBandwidth
Allocated Bandwidth of a given interface and class-level.

item_prototype.name: Byte Rate - Interface ID {$IF_ID1} - Class ID {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIntfBcBytes
Bytes of a given inteface and class-level.

item_prototype.name: Current Bandwidth - Interface ID {$IF_ID1} - Class ID {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIntfBcCurrentBandwidth
Current Bandwidth of a given interface and class-level.

item_prototype.name: Packet Drop - Interface ID {$IF_ID1} - Class ID {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIntfBcDrops
Packet drop counter of a given interface and class-level.

item_prototype.name: Guaranteed Bandwidth - Interface ID {$IF_ID1} - Class ID {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIntfBcGuaranteedBandwidth
Guaranteed Bandwidth of a given interface and class-level.

item_prototype.name: Maximum Bandwidth - Interface ID {$IF_ID1} - Class ID {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIntfBcMaxBandwidth
Max Bandwidth of a given interface and class-level.

discovery_rule.name: Interface-based Shaping (Ingress) Discovery
discovery_rule.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIntfBcInEntry
A list of all class-levels with bandwidth usage and packet drop counter. An entry containing the Bandwidth Control statistics, packet drop counter of a given interface.
For ingress bc use estimated-downstream-bandwidth and ingress-shaping-profile

item_prototype.name: Ingress Allocated Bandwidth - Interface ID {$IF_IN_ID1} - Class ID {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIntfBcInAllocatedBandwidth
Allocated Bandwidth of a given interface and class-level.

item_prototype.name: Ingress Byte Rate - Interface ID {$IF_IN_ID1} - Class ID {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIntfBcInBytes
Bytes of a given inteface and class-level.

item_prototype.name: Ingress Current Bandwidth - Interface ID {$IF_IN_ID1} - Class ID {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIntfBcInCurrentBandwidth
Current Bandwidth of a given interface and class-level.

item_prototype.name: Ingress Packet drop - Interface ID {$IF_IN_ID1} - Class ID {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIntfBcInDrops
Packet drop counter of a given interface and class-level.

item_prototype.name: Ingress Guaranteed Bandwidth - Interface ID {$IF_IN_ID1} - Class ID {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIntfBcInGuaranteedBandwidth
Guaranteed Bandwidth of a given interface and class-level.

item_prototype.name: Ingress Maximum Bandwidth - Interface ID {$IF_IN_ID1} - Class ID {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIntfBcInMaxBandwidth
Max Bandwidth of a given interface and class-level.

discovery_rule.name: CPU Cores Discovery
discovery_rule.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgProcessorEntIndex
A unique identifier within the fgProcessorTable

item_prototype.name: Average Usage of System Process over 1min per Core #{#CPU_ID}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgProcessorSysUsage
The processor's CPU system space usage, which is an average calculated over the last minute. (only valid for processors types that support this statistic).

item_prototype.name: Core #{#CPU_ID} Processor Type
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgProcessorType
An indication of the type of the processor. Types are defined in fgProcessorTypes.

item_prototype.name: Average Usage over 1min per Core #{#CPU_ID}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgProcessorUsage
The processor's CPU usage (percentage), which is an average calculated over the last minute. (only valid for processors types that support this statistic).

item_prototype.name: Average Usage over 5sec per Core #{#CPU_ID}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgProcessorUsage5sec
The processor's CPU usage (percentage), which is an average calculated over the last 5 sec. (only valid for processors types that support this statistic).

item_prototype.name: Average Usage of User Process over 1min per Core #{#CPU_ID}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgProcessorUserUsage
The processor's CPU user space usage, which is an average calculated over the last minute. (only valid for processors types that support this statistic).

graph_prototype.name: Average Usage over 1m and 5s per Core - Core #{#CPU_ID}

discovery_rule.name: SoC3 Discovery
discovery_rule.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgProcessorEntIndex
A unique identifier within the fgProcessorTable

item_prototype.name: SOC3 Packets Dropped
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgProcessorPktDroppedCount
The total number of packets dropped by this processor (only valid for processors types that support this statistic).

item_prototype.name: SOC3 Packets Received
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgProcessorPktRxCount
The total number of packets received by this processor (only valid for processors types that support this statistic).

item_prototype.name: SOC3 Packets Transmitted
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgProcessorPktTxCount
The total number of packets transmitted by this processor (only valid for processors types that support this statistic).

discovery_rule.name: Virtual Domain Discovery
discovery_rule.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVdEntIndex
Internal virtual domain index used to uniquely identify rows in this table. This index is also used by other tables referencing a virtual domain.

item_prototype.name: VDOM {#VDOM_NAME} - CPU Usage
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVdEntCpuUsage
CPU usage of the virtual domain (percentage).

item_prototype.name: VDOM {#VDOM_NAME} - HA Member State
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVdEntHaState
HA cluster member state of the virtual domain on this device (master, backup or standalone)

item_prototype.name: VDOM {#VDOM_NAME} - Memory Usage
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVdEntMemUsage
Memory usage of the virtual domain (percentage).

item_prototype.name: VDOM #{#VDOM_ID} - Name
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVdEntName
The name of the virtual domain

item_prototype.name: VDOM {#VDOM_NAME} - Operation Mode
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVdEntOpMode
Operation mode of the virtual domain (NAT or Transparent)

item_prototype.name: VDOM {#VDOM_NAME} - Active Sessions
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVdEntSesCount
Number of active sessions on the virtual domain.

item_prototype.name: VDOM {#VDOM_NAME} - Session Rate
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVdEntSesRate
The session setup rate on the virtual domain.

trigger_prototype.name: VPN Tunnel Down [{#SNMPVALUE}]
trigger_prototype.description: IPsec VPN Tunnel Phase 2 is down, please check!

item_prototype.name: Available Bidirectional Bandwidth of Performance SLA {#HC_NAME} on SD-WAN member {#MEMBER_SEQ}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVWLHealthCheckLinkBandwidthBi
The available bandwidth in Mbps of bi-direction traffic detected by a health-check on a specific member link.

item_prototype.name: Available Incoming Bandwidth of Performance SLA {#HC_NAME} on SD-WAN member {#MEMBER_SEQ}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVWLHealthCheckLinkBandwidthIn
The available bandwidth in Mbps of incoming traffic detected by a health-check on a specific member link.

item_prototype.name: Available Outgoing Bandwidth of Performance SLA {#HC_NAME} on SD-WAN member {#MEMBER_SEQ}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVWLHealthCheckLinkBandwidthOut
The available bandwidth in Mbps of outgoing traffic detected by a health-check on a specific member link.

item_prototype.name: Packet Loss to {#HC_NAME} on SD-WAN member {#MEMBER_SEQ}
Packets received from {#HC_NAME} on SD-WAN member {#MEMBER_SEQ}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVWLHealthCheckLinkPacketRecv
The total number of packets received by a health check on a specific member link.

item_prototype.name: Packets sent to {#HC_NAME} on SD-WAN member {#MEMBER_SEQ}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVWLHealthCheckLinkPacketSend
The total number of packets sent by a health check on a specific member link.

item_prototype.name: Health Check State to {#HC_NAME} on SD-WAN member {#MEMBER_SEQ}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVWLHealthCheckLinkState
Heatlth check state on a specific member link.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/fgVWLHealthCheckLinkState[{#HC_ID}])=1 and (last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/fgVWLHealthCheckLinkState[{#HC_ID}],#1)<>last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/fgVWLHealthCheckLinkState[{#HC_ID}],#2))=1
trigger_prototype.name: Health Check State Failed to {#HC_NAME} on member {#MEMBER_SEQ}

item_prototype.name: VDOM of Performance SLA {#HC_NAME} on SD-WAN member {#MEMBER_SEQ}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVWLHealthCheckLinkVdom
Virtual domain the link monitor entry exists in. This name corresponds to the fgVdEntName used in fgVdTable.

graph_prototype.name: Performance SLA Metrics to {#HC_NAME} on SD-WAN member {#MEMBER_SEQ}
Probe Packets to {#HC_NAME} on SD-WAN member {#MEMBER_SEQ}

discovery_rule.name: Wireless Discovery
discovery_rule.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpConfigWtpId
Represents the unique identifier of a WTP.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Background Scan
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpConfigRadioApScan
Whether background scan is enabled on this WTP.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Radio Tx Automatic Power Control
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpConfigRadioAutoTxPowerControl
Whether radio automatic TX power control is enabled on this WTP.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Radio Tx Automatic Power Control (High Limit)
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpConfigRadioAutoTxPowerHigh
Represents the high limit of radio automatic TX power control configured for this WTP, in dBm.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Radio Tx Automatic Power Control (Low Limit)
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpConfigRadioAutoTxPowerLow
Represents the low limit of radio automatic TX power control configured for this WTP, in dBm.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Radio Band
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpConfigRadioBand
Represents the radio band configured for this WTP.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Radio Enabled
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpConfigRadioEnable
Whether radio is enabled for this WTP.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Radio Tx Power Level
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpConfigRadioTxPowerLevel
Represents the radio TX power setting configured for this WTP, in percentage.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - VAPs (All)
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpConfigVapAll
Whether all VAPs are selected for this WTP.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - VAPs (List)
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpConfigVaps
Represents a list of VAPs configured for this WTP.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Administrative Status
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpConfigWtpAdmin
Represents the administrative status of this WTP.
discovered(1) - This WTP was discovered though discovery or join request messages. disable(2) - Controller is configured to not provide service to this WTP. enable(3) - Controller is configured to provide service to this WTP. other(0) - The administration state of the WTP is unknown.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Serial Number
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpConfigWtpId
Represents the unique identifier of a WTP.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Location
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpConfigWtpLocation
Represents the location of this WTP.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Name
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpConfigWtpName
Represents the name configured for this WTP.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Profile
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpConfigWtpProfile
Represents the WTP profile configured for this WTP.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Status
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpSessionConnectionState
Represents the connection state of a WTP to AC.
The following enumerated values are supported:
offLine(1) - The WTP is not connected. onLine(2) - The WTP is connected. downloadingImage(3) - The WTP is downloading software image from the AC on joining. connectedImage(4) - The AC is pushing software image to the connected WTP. other(0) - The WTP connection state is unknown.

trigger_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} is receiving firmware update from {HOST.NAME}

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Base MAC Address
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpSessionWtpBaseMacAddress
Represents the WTP's Base MAC Address, which MAY be assigned to the primary Ethernet interface. The instance of the object corresponds to the Base MAC Address sub-element in the CAPWAP protocol [RFC5415].

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Version (Bootloader)
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpSessionWtpBootVersion
Represents the boot loader version of a WTP.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Byte Count Rate (Rx)
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpSessionWtpByteRxCount
Represents the number of bytes received by this WTP.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Byte Count Rate (Tx)
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpSessionWtpByteTxCount
Represents the number of bytes transmitted by this WTP.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - CPU Usage
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpSessionWtpCpuUsage
Represents the current CPU usage of a WTP (percentage).

trigger_prototype.name: High CPU usage (over {$CPU.UTIL.CRIT}% for 5m) - FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Uptime (Daemon)
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpSessionWtpDaemonUpTime
Represents the time (in hundredths of a second) since the WTP daemon has been started.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Version (Hardware)
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpSessionWtpHwVersion
Represents the hardware version of a WTP.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - IP Address
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpSessionWtpIpAddress
Represents the IP address of a WTP that corresponds to the IP address in the IP packet header.
The format of this IP address is determined by the corresponding instance of object gWcWtpWtpIpAddressType.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - IP Address Type
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpSessionWtpIpAddressType
Represents the IP address type of a WTP. Only ipv4(1) and ipv6(2) are supported by the object.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Local IP Address
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpSessionWtpLocalIpAddress
Represents the local IP address of a WTP and models the CAPWAP Local IPv4 Address or CAPWAP Local IPv6 Address fields [RFC5415]. If a Network Address Translation (NAT) device is present between WTP and AC, the value of fgWcWtpWtpLocalIpAddress will be different from the value of fgWcWtpWtpIpAddress. The format of this IP address is determined by the corresponding instance of object fgWcWtpSessionWtpLocalIpAddressType.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Local IP Address Type
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpSessionWtpLocalIpAddressType
Represents the local IP address type of a WTP. Only ipv4(1) and ipv6(2) are supported by the object.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Memory Capacity
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpSessionWtpMemoryCapacity
Represents the total physical memory (RAM) installed (KB).

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Memory Usage
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpSessionWtpCpuUsage
Represents the current memory usage of a WTP (percentage).

trigger_prototype.name: High memory usage (over {$MEMORY.UTIL.MAX}% for 5m) - FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: The system is running out of free memory.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Model Number
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpSessionWtpModelNumber
Represents the model number of a WTP.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Profile Name
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpSessionWtpProfileName
Represents the profile configured for this WTP.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Region Code
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpSessionWtpRegionCode
Represents the region code programmed for this WTP.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Uptime (Session)
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpSessionWtpSessionUpTime
Represents the time (in hundredths of a second) since the WTP connects to the AC.

trigger_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} session with {HOST.NAME} has been restarted
trigger_prototype.description: Session between FAP and FG was restarted. Ack to close.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Connected Clients
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpSessionWtpStationCount
Represents the number of clients currently connected to this WTP.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Version (Software)
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpSessionWtpSwVersion
Represents the software version of a WTP.

item_prototype.name: FortiAP {#SNMPVALUE} - Uptime
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgWcWtpSessionWtpUpTime
Represents the time (in hundredths of a second) since the WTP boots.

discovery_rule.name: Network interfaces discovery
discovery_rule.description:
Discovering interfaces from IF-MIB.
+
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIntfEntry
Fortinet specific extensions to MIB-2 ifTable.
Fortinet specific information about an ifEntry. This table augments the standard ifTable, so the same indexing is used.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Estimated downstream bandwidth
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIntfEntEstDownBandwidth
Estimated maximum downstream bandwidth (Kbps). Used to estimate link utilization.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Estimated upstream bandwidth
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIntfEntEstUpBandwidth
Estimated maximum upstream bandwidth (Kbps). Used to estimate link utilization.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): VDOM
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIntfEntVdom
The virtual domain the interface belongs to. This index corresponds to the index used by fgVdTable.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Duplex status
item_prototype.description:
MIB: EtherLike-MIB The current mode of operation of the MAC entity. 'unknown' indicates that the current duplex mode could not be determined.
Management control of the duplex mode is accomplished through the MAU MIB. When an interface does not support autonegotiation, or when autonegotiation is not enabled, the duplex mode is controlled using ifMauDefaultType. When autonegotiation is supported and enabled, duplex mode is controlled using ifMauAutoNegAdvertisedBits. In either case, the currently operating duplex mode is reflected both in this object and in ifMauType.
Note that this object provides redundant information with ifMauType. Normally, redundant objects are discouraged. However, in this instance, it allows a management application to determine the duplex status of an interface without having to know every possible value of ifMauType. This was felt to be sufficiently valuable to justify the redundancy. Reference: [IEEE 802.3 Std.], 30.3.1.1.32,aDuplexStatus.

trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): In half-duplex mode
trigger_prototype.description: Please check autonegotiation settings and cabling

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Inbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Inbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits received
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifInOctets. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Outbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Outbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of outbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits sent
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifOutOctets.Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Speed
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in units of 1,000,000 bits per second. If this object reports a value of `n' then the speed of the interface is somewhere in the range of `n-500,000' to`n+499,999'. For interfaces which do not vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this object should contain the nominal bandwidth. For a sub-layer which has no concept of bandwidth, this object should be zero.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Operational status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The current operational state of the interface. - The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packet scan be passed - If ifAdminStatus is down(2) then ifOperStatus should be down(2) - If ifAdminStatus is changed to up(1) then ifOperStatus should change to up(1) if the interface is ready to transmit and receive network traffic - It should change todormant(5) if the interface is waiting for external actions (such as a serial line waiting for an incoming connection) - It should remain in the down(2) state if and only if there is a fault that prevents it from going to the up(1) state - It should remain in the notPresent(6) state if the interface has missing(typically, hardware) components.

trigger_prototype.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and (last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))=1)
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
trigger_prototype.description:
This trigger expression works as follows: 1. Can be triggered if operations status is down. 2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down. 3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)
WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Interface type
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The type of interface. Additional values for ifType are assigned by the Internet Assigned NumbersAuthority (IANA), through updating the syntax of the IANAifType textual convention.

trigger_prototype.expression: change(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])<0 and last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])>0 and ( last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=6 or last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=7 or last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=11 or last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=62 or last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=69 or last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=117 ) and (last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])<>2)
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: (change(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])>0 and last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2)>0) or (last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2)
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
trigger_prototype.description: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Ack to close.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and (last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))=1)

trigger_prototype.expression: (avg(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.in[ifHCInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}]) or avg(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.out[ifHCOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])) and last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])>0
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: avg(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.in[ifHCInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}]) and avg(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.out[ifHCOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High bandwidth usage (>{$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}% )
trigger_prototype.description: The network interface utilization is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and (last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))=1)

trigger_prototype.expression: min(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.in.errors[ifInErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} or min(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.out.errors[ifOutErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: max(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.in.errors[ifInErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8 and max(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.out.errors[ifOutErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High error rate (>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and (last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))=1)

macro.description: High CPU usage trigger threshold
High ICMP ping loss trigger threshold
High ICMP ping response time trigger threshold (s)
High error rate trigger threshold
High bandwidth usage trigger threshold
Control if up-down state change will trigger
Interface ID where Egress Shaping is configured
Interface ID where Ingress Shaping is configured
High memory usage trigger threshold
Ignore notPresent(6) - LOOKS WRONG
Ignore down(2) administrative status
Match all by default
Change to exclude interfaces from discovery
Match all by default
Change to exclude interfaces from discovery
Match all by default
Filter out loopbacks, nulls, docker veth links and docker0 bridge by default
Interfaces with up(1) Operational Status are discovered.
Ignore notPresent(6)
Match all by default. Details at https://www.iana.org/assignments/ianaiftype-mib/ianaiftype-mib
Change to exclude interfaces from discovery
No SNMP data collection trigger threshold

value.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Network Bandwidth Usage
HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Security Events Rate
HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Network Bandwidth Usage
HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Security Events Rate
Performance SLA Metrics to {#HC_NAME} on SD-WAN member {#MEMBER_SEQ}
